body:
**Environment**:
-  VMware
- CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511 (Core)
- kernel: 3.10.0-327.36.1.el7.x86_64
- Installed packages:
  kubeadm.x86_64                       1.5.0-0.alpha.0.1534.gcf7301f

kubectl.x86_64                           1.4.0-0

kubelet.x86_64                           1.4.0-0

kubernetes-cni.x86_64               0.3.0.1-0.07a8a2

docker-engine.x86_64                1.11.2-1.el7.centos

docker-engine-selinux.noarch    1.12.1-1.el7.centos

**What happened**:
kubeadm init hangs indefintely after:
kubeadm init
<master/tokens> generated token: "c645e2.9558b825e5be0fa6"
<master/pki> created keys and certificates in "/etc/kubernetes/pki"
<util/kubeconfig> created "/etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf"
<util/kubeconfig> created "/etc/kubernetes/admin.conf"
<master/apiclient> created API client configuration
<master/apiclient> created API client, waiting for the control plane to become readykubeadm init

**What you expected to happen**:
Master node initialize

**Anything else do we need to know**:
Only the kubeadm and kublet processes are running. When I do docker ps no containers are running.
If i type docker images the only image that has been downloaded are: gcr.io/google_containers/pause-amd64

I've also tried: kubeadm init --api-advertise-addresses but with the same outcome (followed the clean-up at http://kubernetes.io/docs/getting-started-guides/kubeadm/)

Im behind a firewall so I'm using proxy settings for docker. I have confirmed I can reach images on docker hub and google cloud registry
title: kubeadm hangs after 'waiting for the control plane' on Centos 7.2
